channel.title: How to make a desktop client 659
channel.description: I'm done coding more on project dungeonfest and all i need now is how to make a desktop client for any 659 supporting client if someone can just tell me what to do thanks

item.description:

[quote=“zingerman111, post:12, topic:425837”]ok so you saying i need to go download to clients one that will connect everyone to my server with the no-ip
and one client that will let me connect to server with 127.0.0.1[/quote]yes exactly

item.source: How to make a desktop client 659

item.title: How to make a desktop client 659
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“zingerman111, post:10, topic:425837”]ok so if my client ip has to be 127.0.0.1 then where do i plug in my ip or no-ip

This just literally confused me XD[/quote]

I am going to need a drink after this :rolleyes:

Client #1 - YOUR CLIENT

  • set your clientsettings.java ip to 127…0.0.1

Client #2 - EVERYONE BUT YOU CLIENT

-set your clientsettings.java ip to the no-ip or whatever

you have to have a separate client for your own use in other words.

Read full topic

saying connection timed out please try again so i think im still missing somewhere in client where i have to add my ip[/quote]

…

YOUR client has to be 127.0.0.1 everyone else uses the no-ip or whatever

item.title: How to make a desktop client 659
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

In software, JAR (for Java Archive) is an archive file format typically used to aggregate many Java class files and associated metadata and resources (text, images and so on) into one file to distribute application software or libraries on the Java platform.[1]

JAR files are built on the ZIP file format and have the .jar file extension. Computer users can create or extract JAR files using the jar command that comes with a JDK. They can also use zip tools to do so; however, the order of entries in the zip file headers is important when compressing, as the manifest often needs to be first.

Read full topic
